186024065.review:
Je cale un 8.2/10 sachant que j'ai encore pas mal à découvrir.
J'ai pris le jeu en décembre 2024 sur PC, pas mal de choses ont bougé à priori depuis sa sortie.

Exploration, aventure, construction de base, combat, gameplay, commu, je détaille rapido :

Exploration 10/10 : c'est juste infini, vous pouvez aller partout quand vous voulez, sous l'eau, sur terre et dans l'espace !

Aventure 9/10 : complète et intéressante, trop de skip c'est mal ^^

Construction de base 7/10 : assez basique, elle occupe le temps

Combat 8/10 : sortez le flingue ou le vaisseau spatial (custom :p), si vous êtes malin y'a de quoi s'amuser !

Gameplay 7/10 : difficile à prendre en main et des petites choses à savoir si vous voulez avancer correctement (direction internet ^^). Conseil : lisez bien toutes les technologies.

Communauté 8/10 : à chaque fois que j'ai eu besoin, j'ai trouvé des réponses :)

Un mot sur le multi qui n'a pas l'air exaltant hélas mais c'est sûrement dû à mon manque d'expérience. A creuser.
Pour finir je m'éclate, un jeu solo dément qui donne le tournis, beaucoup de choses sont bien faites, bien pensées pour une expérience agréable.

186017106.review:
C’est un super jeu d’exploration, sûrement l’un des meilleurs. La carte est vraiment infinie, et avec les dernières mises à jour, le jeu ne paraît plus vide du tout ! Il y a plein de choses à faire. Bon, c’est vrai que le gameplay peut devenir un peu répétitif au bout d’un moment (surtout quand il s’agit de collecter des ressources), mais on finit toujours par découvrir quelque chose de nouveau. 

Après plus de 40 heures de jeu, je continue de tomber sur des surprises, avec des mondes magnifiques à explorer. Ce jeu est parfait pour moi et sans doute pour plein d’autres aussi ! Il est relaxant, axé sur l’exploration, avec des objectifs, mais on peut aussi juste se balader, admirer les paysages ou pêcher. 

Le seul point faible pour moi, ce sont les combats, que je trouve vraiment mauvais. Une bonne mise à jour à ce niveau-là rendrait le jeu encore meilleur. Sinon, No Man’s Sky a encore beaucoup à offrir, et j’espère que les développeurs vont continuer à sortir des mises à jour pour le jeu ne cesse de s’améliorer !

186007666.review:
So, first of all, it's the game that keeps me interested for 150+ hours, which does not happen so often recently. Basically, it is a simulation of living in a sci-fi world. You can do what you want and the most of things feel quite realistic. You have sent your ship for a mission and it returned home damaged? You teleport on it and fix manually each damaged part climbing all the stairs in open space. Space pirates are scanning your cargo and are not going to attack you if you do not have anything valuable. And yes, you can actually do what you want to do. Just think of what would you do if space travelling was possible in reality and 99% you can do it in the game. With quite a level of realism. It's one of those games where I am really feeling scared when making scary things. 
Now to minuses:
The main one for me is that almost everything you can exploit. So yeah, the game has really a lot of different activities, but each one of them has glitches or is not thought through. Like you have a plant which produces Carbon every 10 minutes. Collect the carbon, move the plant and collect the carbon again. Repeat it as many times as you need. Whatever you need, you almost sure can google an easy way to get for free. So yeah, those are bugs and they are everywhere. Like...Everywhere... The solution - do not google :) 
Another issue - the interface. It is playable but there are quite un-orthodox solutions lets call it that. Needs time to get used to. The base building after 150+ hours is still very cumbersome for me. 
The level of realism in some aspects makes it look really silly, when some other aspects are not thought through: build a deep-ocean base module on a beach, and during the storm the waves will very beautifully get inside it, ignoring its floor and walls. 
And (al-)chemistry. It could be done much more logical. There is some logic in some formulas, but I would prefer to keep the real transformations a part of it. Like 1 carbon + 2 oxygen = 1 dioxite. (In game 1 carbon + 2 oxygen = 1 "condensed carbon" if I'm not mistaken, even though dioxite exists, but you are getting it from 1 carbon + 1 sodium nitrate. For some reason - and like this is all other chemistry. And yep, dioxite is not a gas, but solid :) So if you think you will also get some real chemistry in the game - nope. Completely fantastic formulas for the elements with real names.

186007582.review:
Получаю колоссальное удовольствие играя в шлеме VR. 
За столь не долгое время, что я успел провести в игре, я считаю, что игра уже окупила свою стоимость.
 Играю на стандартном режиме сложности как "творец и выживальщик".
Особенно понравился момент, когда основным квестом меня принесло на заснеженную планету, где я нашел заброшенный корабль, который можно восстановить. Но задача не решалась одним днем, поэтому я основал базу на месте заброшенного корабля и начал поиск ресурсов для его восстановления. Хотя это не имело отношения к основному квесту. И случайно находя какую либо ценную вещь (заброшенный корабль, нуждающийся в восстановлении) я получил больше удовольствия, чем есле бы я его купил на станции новеньким.
Я понимаю что основные квесты когда-нибудь закончатся, но есть место на космической станции где можно брать различные задания с вознаграждениями, которые займут еще порядочно времени, т.к. даже один космический "прыжок" требует значительных ресурсов.
Помимо этого в игре можно строить разнообразные базы с большим набором декоративных предметов и частей базы. Мне нравится строить дома со окнами в крыше чтобы смотреть на небо. Кстати, режим строения очень удобный, можно строить что угодно и как угодно.
Также есть большой рост в нише вашего костюма, здесь же и наземный транспорт, корабли и т.д.. Добавить к этому постоянную нужду в ресурсах и выживании - получается очень занятная игра.
На последок, игра дает ощущение приключения, дает почувствовать себя выживальщиком-скитальцем. Я уже успел пару раз отбиваться от пиратов в воздушно-космическом бое на кораблях. Получилось здорово, прямо как в симуляторе пилотирования.
Лично я люблю отключать внутриигровой саундтрек и слушать лишь звуки окружающей среды. Вот случайно я открыл для себя пустынную планету, стою на ней и слушаю звуки шумящего ветра, повсюду песок, гигантские каньоны и кактусы; или же пробираться сквозь бурю на ледяной планете, под свист метели, смотря как садятся показатели жизнеобеспечения костюма и замерзающий шлем-визор. И все это в VR. Без VR игра тоже прекрасна - и картинка по сочнее без VR, конечно.
Но попробовав ее в VR, даже не хочу играть без VR в нее. Она на столько погружает в себя, что ради нее, думаю, стоит взять шлем виртуальной реальности.
За все недолгое время странствий встретил лишь одну планету с базой от другого игрока. Вселенная там действительно громадная. Все ваши базы загружаются на общий сервер. Все что вы создадите, может увидеть другой игрок, если случайно наткнется на вашу планету.
Мне очень понравилась игра, пожалуй  моя лучшая покупка после gta 5 =)

185986704.review:
I don't normally review games, but I felt like I had to for this one. This game is ridiculous. In a good way. Not only does it run INCREDIBLY well with high graphics on my 7 year old GPU but it absolutely CRUSHES everything from gameplay to the game design. The character and ship movement is fluid and fun (especially space combat, its super simple and fun to do). 

I'm sure most of the people reading this are probably aware of this games procedural generating, and that another thing that puts No Man's Sky above other games. Despite the fact there are literally millions of planets, there will always be beautiful moments that just make you stop and say damn. 

When I was choosing whether or not to get No Man's Sky. There were a few other games up against it, like Starfield and Star Citizen. They're obviously very different games, but they all have their own way of letting you experience space exploration. After taking a risk and buying No Man's Sky I can say with absolute certainty I made the right choice! I love this game and everything in it.

For anyone unsure about whether or not to get this game, I cannot recommend it enough. With the constant updates and different modes ships to match play styles there is really no limit to how you want to play, there's even first person combat if you desire it :) Just be aware that it isn't a fast paced kind of game, its for you to enjoy and experience as if you WERE the character. I hope this helps!

185981112.review:
It's frustrating. 

There is way too much UI, and somehow it barely explains anything while covering more than half of your screen.

The Controls don't make sense, like braking and lock on being tied to the same control by default. Also certain keys (like caps-lock) cant be bound to actions.

The Camera dynamically zooms in and out without user control and it feels like the look sensitivity changes with it. First Person felt weird and clunky. Using the Mining laser zooms in your camera in and it gets stuck like that until you sprint. 

The inventory is lessened when you select survival difficulty, which is fine, but they pick and choose random slots to take away from the menu which added to my confusion thinking their was actually different types of inventory slots.

The flying feels weird, both with tethered mode on or off.

I got randomly attacked by sentinels because I did what the game spent the first 3 hours teaching me to do (collect resources). The game didn't explain they would just keep coming so I wasted a bunch of resources in a never ending battle. And then I quit because I had enough.

185936405.review:
[h2] Ты ....кззззз... не ....кззззззз.... одинок.  [/h2]
 
Бескрайние просторы для исследования поражают своими чудовищными размерами. Разнообразие диковинной фауны и флоры выходят за пределы фантазии обычного человека. Мистические древние обелиски, хранящие в себе тайну эпохи минувших дней. Кто есть я ? Я есть странник, мой голод исследования неутолим, моё желание побывать в каждом уголке вселенной - необъятно. Но так ли это на самом деле? Смотря часами напролет на звездное небо никому неизвестной кроме тебя звездной системы заставляет задуматься, кто же я есть на самом деле? Странник? Ошибка в системе? Или же палач, пожелавший исполнить заветную мечту силы, стоящей выше всего этого? Исполнить ли долг и покончить эпоху ШЕСТНАДЦАТЬ или же остаться и продолжить исследователя дальше? Вселенная медленно умирает, но пока есть время, можно насладится этим прекрасным моментом. 

Это игра No  Man`s Sky и мне хотелось бы немного рассказать о моём опыте игры, выделив плюсы и минусы проекта.
  
 [h3] Плюсы [/h3]
- Игра является бездонной чашей для исследования (В контексте РЕАЛЬНОЙ человеческой жизни)
- Огромная вариация космических кораблей, которыми может управлять игрок. 
- Широкая кастомизация персонажа
- Неплохие возможности для постройки своей собственной базы.
- Неплохая даже по меркам  25 года графика.
- Самобытная стилистика. 
- Отличный расслабляющий саундтрек. Я бы даже сказал он добавляет в геймплей какой-то медитативности, что на мой взгляд, несомненно плюс.
- Игра позволяет выбрать режим камеры - от первого лица либо от третьего.  Полеты на космическом аппарате в режиме от первого лица занимают отдельно место в моем сердечке.
- Система торговли с  NPC.
- Система репутации рас.
- Побочные квесты от гильдий.
- Мультиплеер. Хотя я бы назвал это кооперативом, об этом в минусах проекта.
- К слову о мультиплеере, в игре присутствует система событий, названная "экспедициями" - игроку вместе с другими игрокам предлагают начать новое путешествие на определенной планете. Выполняя этапы экспедиции игроки продвигаются по маршруту экспедиции, при выполнении всех этапов вас будет ожидать приятный бонус. К слову. Экспедии временные, а награды можно получить уже на основное сохранение.
- С недавнего времени в игре присутствует рыбалка.
- В игре можно основать свое поселение и руководить им (Отчасти плюс, отчасти минус, реализация уровня тамагочи)
- Случайные события в космосе, например атака пиратского дредноута на торговый караван.
- Вы можете получить своё торговое судно, которое может стать вашим передвижным домом, а также иметь почти пассивный заработок с экспедиций вашего флота, принадлежащего вашему основному большому судну.

 [h3] Минусы [/h3]
- Наверное для казуальных игроков это прозвучит плюсом, но игра слабо ограничивает тебя в ресурсах, ты можешь потратить буквально пару часиков на то чтобы построить несколько шахтерских баз по добыче тех или иных ресурсов и всё, на этом дефицит ресурсов пропадает, да и еще можно реализовать массовое производство дорогостоящих крафтовых ресурсов, так что местная валюта где-то на часу 10 перестает быть каким либо фактором ограничения, а раз уж фармить валюту не нужно, то это минус к мотивации что-то делать в пользу фарма валюты.
- Мультиплеер. Да я вписал его в плюсы, но в целом он тут для галочки. Я не просто написал что это скорее кооператив, но даже как кооператив тут с натяжкой. Вы можете поиграть с друзьями и что-то вместе поделать, но вы не ощутите разницы игры в одиночку и с кем-то еще. Экспедиции хотя и аккумулируют игроков в определенной точке галактики, какого-то необходимого взаимодействия между игроками здесь не реализовано, так что экспедиции ощущаются скорее маленькими сюжетными дополнениями к основной игре.
- Однообразие планет. Да, я апплодирую разработчикам за то, что всё в их игре является процедурно генерируемым, это по настоящему гениальное решение. Но проблема в том что на планетах контент очень однообразен и специфичного контента здесь мало. Количество видов фауны и флоры просто мизерно в масштабах одной планеты и кроме раннего этапа игры в основном здесь нечего делать.
- Однообразие заданий гильдии. Скажу кратко - здесь всё завязано на "Принеси  Y, Доставь X в точку А, Уничтожь N животных определенного вида на планете G." Этим интересно заниматься приблизительно заданий 7-10. Дальше это превращается в рутину. 
- Добавлю к однообразию заданий: стимулирующий что-то делать контент заканчивается где-то на 50ом часу игры. Дальше игра не стимулирует вас что-то делать в ней, вы сам себе режиссер, это можно было бы поставить к плюсам проекта, но я поставлю к минусам, определенного желания заходить в нее нет. Иначе говоря - в игре отсутствует какая-то конкретная цель, за исключением "добраться до центра галактики".
- NPC. Несмотря на то что в игре вам часто встречаются  NPC, они ощущаются как болванчики, с которыми мало как можно взаимодействовать. Вы можете попросить научить вас слово определенной расы. Поторговать и в редких случаях помочь определенными ресурсами. На этом с взаимодействием ВСЁ. Мир кажется пустым и безжизненным. 

Несмотря на увесистые минусы проекта, игра затянула меня на 200 с лишним часов и мне немного тяжело прощаться с проектом. Даже если миры пусты, эта атмосфера одинокого странника завораживает, как и завораживают живописные миры этой игры. 

 Игра не для всех. Она для тех, кто хочет спокойного медитативного время провождения. Возможно Шон Мюррей этого и хотел, чтобы игра создала определенное настроение для игрока, чтобы можно было подумать о чем то [b]большем[/b].

185930417.review:
[h1]The following content contains spoilers:[/h1]
[spoiler] No Man's Sky is like you open a door to the universe, and you find that there are countless planets waiting for you to explore behind the door, but it seems that all the planets look the same. At first, you may feel that you have fallen into the dilemma of "starting with a ship and picking up all the equipment", but with updates and improvements, the game gradually becomes more and more rich - it is like a cosmic "obsessive-compulsive disorder", always giving you new tasks, updates, and new planets, so that you keep returning to the game and experience how addictive "interstellar exploration" is over and over again.

Whether it is negotiating with aliens, scavenging resources, or traveling between the stars, you can always find something interesting to do. Although it may be a bit doubtful at first "what am I really doing", the charm of the game is that you never know what surprises the next planet will bring you. Is it a grassland planet that completely meets your aesthetics, or a rock that looks like alien stinky tofu?

For me, No Man's Sky is a perfect "cosmic treadmill", you are always exploring, but you can't find the end. And when you finally find yourself trapped in it, you don't want to stop, because the universe is too big and you want to see more.[/spoiler] 

[h3] The following is in ancient Chinese😊[/h3] 
《无人深空》如汝开宇宙之门，则其门背有无数星球等求之，又如凡星球皆相似。初，汝或落局一舟，负之全资，而新与改善，戏渐更增益——犹宇宙等“强便”，恒为你新任、新星球，令数还嬉戏中，一验之“星际究险”，果何其工夫也。无论与外星人对判、搜括之类也。仍游于星际，能得其意而行也。虽初疑有人之疑“我亦何为”，而戏之速力在于——汝终不知下星球与汝何喜也。是全合汝审美草原星球，抑一眼似外星臭腐之石？若我言《无人深空》为一完完全之“宇宙步机”，总求之于寻，考之无穷。若乃卒睹其陷，而不欲止者，宇宙之大，更思众矣。

After 50 hours, write a game experience:
It's a fun game that can travel through planets, find rare materials/build home technology, and be full of adventure, but No Man's Sky still has problems: the gameplay on each planet is repetitive; Combat is still boring and can be avoided as much as possible; There are still a lot of bugs. But once you've explored enough resources to buy new ships and work hard to build them, you'll still be able to support players for a long time. At the same time, at the 2024 TGA conference, No Man's Sky gave players a spaceship for free after winning the Best Community Game Award. It's the biggest open-world game on the map, and I recommend it!

185910846.review:
[h3]My dear reader! Now I feel that I played this game enough to share my mind with you...[/h3]

[i]Usually I don't write reviews for the games of mine. But you know what? This game is quite a worthy one![/i]

Firstly, I'd like to tell you why I enjoyed this game so much.
Imagine that you have [b]THE WHOLE UNIVERSE[/b] to [b]EXPLORE[/b]! This is what No Man's Sky is about. Every inch of this universe—every galaxy [spoiler](hell yeah, it has not just one)[/spoiler], every star system, every planet—is yours to visit.
Another strong advantage of the NMS is that you can play the game exactly [u]the way you want[/u]. It has a lot of gameplay options to make your [b]OWN[/b] unforgettable experience. Also, this game is very player-friendly. If you don't want to do something, you never have to! Of course it has some tough challenges, but they have some sweet awards, so you can barely get bored. 

And of course, as any game does, No Man's Sky has its cons. For me, the main one of them is that all the plot is given by short text messages describing you and the conditions you're in. But if you have a strong imagination, that will not be such a problem.

The game is highly supported by the developers, so it gets regular and [b]FREE[/b] ([u]you must pay for the game only once[/u]) updates with bunches of content. 

Well, if you ask me whether you should buy this game or not, my answer is [b]absolutely yes[/b]. No matter what age you are or how much gaming experience you have, NMS will definitely give you some amazing and unforgettable experiences!

185910021.review:
This game left me speechless. I picked it up years and years ago, and tried to play it, but could never get into it long enough to even leave the first solar system. NMS sat in my steam library for a good 6 or 7 or so years collecting dust, until my curiosity at hearing that it had received tons upon tons of updates made me boot it up in 2023 to try playing it in VR mode with a friend. I got immediately hooked. Even after 7 years of technically having the game, this playthrough was essentially a blind one. I still knew absolutely nothing of the story or most gameplay mechanics.

This VR playthrough didn't get all the way to the "end" of the game, and I ended up coming back in January 2025 with a PC playthrough. Both of these playthroughs left me completely enthralled. The game is beautiful. The spaceflight is amazing. The starship combat. The freighters are satisfying. Almost everything about this game is great, and I can't recommend it enough. Just avoid starship combat if you can. If sentinels are attacking you, land and fight the ground units, it is much more fun.

185896391.review:
NO SPOILERS
TL/DR if you like 3rd person shooters where you only have 1 gun and have to grind endlessly to upgrade it, then this game is for you. If you like to explore, solve puzzles, and scan flora and fauna then this game might SEEM like it's for you, because it has all that, but you cannot avoid combat. Overall it just gets more and more annoying. Based on that I have to say I don't recommend this game. Still, maybe you will find the awkwardly unbalanced blend of combat and exploration appealing. I don't.

I made the mistake of buying the game pretty early on. I gave this game more chances than any game. I have started new 3 separate times, all more than a year apart, hoping it would finally capture my attention and make me want to come back. This last time I really thought I would finally get into it, and I did, for a while.

The problem is the more I get into it, the more it seems to be becoming a frustrating 3rd person shooter. Everything seems to lead to having to fight the Sentinels. I wouldn't mind so much if there was more variety or more ways of avoiding them besides running for a good 5 mins straight while being shot at, but just about everything leads you to an encounter with them, and it just starts to feel really repetitive. If the mission I'm on doesn't deal directly with fighting Sentinels, it will almost certainly lead to it, whether it's trying to take 2 steps outside your ship on a planet with "aggressive sentinels," or harvest anything worthwhile without attracting their attention.

I love combat games but this one has so much potential for exploration, crafting, etc, the combat just feels out of place. It's poorly implemented. If this game was an FPS focusing on fighting the Sentinels, and was well executed that would be one thing, but the combat in this game is sluggish and frustrating. You have no real ability to dodge enemy attacks and your attacks feel unreliable and inaccurate.

At some point it starts to feel like GTA without weapon options or places to take cover. You can find upgrades once you unlock a certain point in the game, which is nice but they are very expensive and require even more resources to install. It would be really nice if there was a real way to take cover, so you could develop a reliable strategy besides tanking damage and frantically trying to take them out one by one. If you die, you respawn with no inventory so good luck if your restore point happens to be in the combat zone. You will have no ammo. Too many frustrated Alt-F4 moments.

Maybe I just have to stick with it and keep grinding for upgrades until I can deal with Sentinels more efficiently, or maybe something will lead to them having less of a presence, but something tells me it's only going to get worse. I really want to explore this game and solve the mysteries lurking behind every asteroid and shrub, but the constant Sentinel presence is becoming very un-fun. Sadly, I'm afraid this game is destined for uninstall once and for all.

Talk me out of it in the comments.

185894896.review:
Начинается игра: очнулся на какой-то кислотной помойке, на башку капает радиоактивный дождь, а костюм пищит так, будто я уже сдох. Думаю: «Ну, нормально, сейчас разберусь». Через пять минут беготни меня съела гигантская корова-мутант. ахуенно, игра мечты.

Нашёл корабль, кое-как починил. Взлетаю, радуюсь жизни, а игра такая: «Внимание! Пираты!» Окей, я готов! Начинаю перестрелку, стреляю во всё, что движется. Только потом понял, что половину времени стрелял сам по себе. Корабль горит, я горю, игра намекает: «Может, хватит позориться?»

Полетел на другую планету, чтобы расслабиться. Выхожу из корабля, смотрю: какие-то чудные зверюшки бегают. Достал анализатор, подумал: «Сейчас назову тебя Пуська». Подошёл ближе — эта "Пуська" начала гнаться за мной, ревя так, будто я ей знатно испортил жизнь. Я еле успел нырнуть обратно в корабль, но она успела насрать мне на крыло.

На 15-м часу игры я решил заняться строительством базы. Собрал материалы, настроил красивый домик, поставил кресло и подумал: «Вот оно, спокойствие». Ага, как бы не так. На следующий день выяснилось, что я построил базу на миграционном пути огромных насекомых. Теперь у меня в гостях каждый вечер межгалактическая тусовка тараканов.

10/10, игра шикарная. Если вы мечтали почувствовать себя главным лохом Вселенной — это то, что нужно. Рекомендую всем, кто хочет потеряться в космосе, обосраться от всего подряд и понять, что хуже, чем ты сам, только твои решения.

Purchased this in 2016 when it first came out. Played a bit then and while I thought it had promise, I found the gameplay shallow at the time and unsatisfying.

I came back in 2024 and started over - and its night and day different. The game has a lot of various systems to satisfy various game play tastes (fps, exploration, base building, collecting) and the expeditions system makes it a lot of fun to play with others.

The amount of effort put into keeping this game going over 8 years and doing nothing but improve is remarkable. 

I still find after playing it for a month or two nearly non-stop that the joy went out after a while. Its not that its not fun but the open-world, open-ended gameplay style leaves one withour purpose after a time. This may not be an issue to everyone, but it is for me. 

But its ok, I put a couple hundred hours into the game and got my moneys worth and highly recommend playing it - its just not everyones forever game is all.

185805985.review:
I rarely write a review, but this game deserves one.

70+ hours in so far

VISUALS  8 / 10  
I got recommended to try VR on it as it immerses you even more but for the PC version on ultrawide screen game is just amazing visual wise, there are creatures that look too animated but as I've heard game developers are keeping good eye on upgrading visual side of the game so 8 points may raise in future as it can get more realistic.

STORY  7 / 10  
There's the primary missions and the secondary, after you are done with those missions some of them start to repeat nonstop on both categories so it can get very repetitive at the end, but there are expedition missions you can try which are rotating as I know so hopefully in the future it gets more NPC characters or additions creativity is enormous here for the game to evolve story side as well.

EXPLORATION 10/10
There is nothing bad to say about this as game really stands above some in its genre regarding exploration, so really well done. 
Also having tech to scan everything, upload them into discoveries, share them with community and journal it really makes this part of the game real.

SPACE 9/10
Some games of this genre have either very complex or very unrealistic gameplay in space, especially when its infinite in its way, so NMS really did find a middle ground as its neither very complex and neither too unrealistic for you to find it goofy so warping around star systems with ship or frigates is just awesome and engaging into combat with your ship is very fun as well. 

There are some other aspects like multiplayer, base building and individual creative missions you can come up with for yourself however, for me these 4 are why I bought the game so, to sum up, its just so much fun when you get started initially, and if it gets repetitive you can always try building bases creativity is limitless, try multiplayer with other players and whatever else comes in the future.

Warm regards to developers 
Traveller

Es un juego interesante. Tiene muchas mecánicas. Tiene sus notitas de juego de terror, cuando investigas oscuros cargueros abandonados llenos de criaturas malignas y manos amputadas flotando sin gravedad a tu alrededor... tiene sus notitas de juego de granjas, cuando construyes invernaderos para cultivar y crías animales alienígenas para conseguir amistad, leche, monturas, etc.

Tiene sus notitas de juego de construcción con las bases, de gestión con los asentamientos, de exploración en los muchos mundos alienígenas, de combate espacial cuando te atacan los piratas... En este juego pasan muchísimas cosas. 

Todo está a medio cocer, pero todo es funcional. Hay bugs pero ninguno que haya encontrado que rompa enteramente la experiencia. 

Por eso es un juego peculiar. Si te gusta la libertad y orientar tus juegos en la dirección que tú quieres, si te gustan los sandbox, si eres fan de minecraft o de juegos como subnautica o valheim... esto es para ti. Me recuerda un poco a skyrim, lo creas o no, tiene un rollo raro parecido a lo del sangre de dragón, en la historia principal.

Si ninguno de esos juegos te dice nada, enhorabuena (o quizá deba decir "lo lamento"), eres ese 1% y no vas a sacar nada bueno de aquí.

185697187.review:
No Man's Sky, el juego que resurgió de sus propias cenizas.
Compré este juego en su lanzamiento (grave error en su momento). Estaba plagado de bugs, una historia inconsistente, faltaba variedad... y calidad en el producto. Aún así, decidí quedármelo.

Años después decidí darle otra oportunidad, y no me arrepiento de haberlo tenido guardado en la biblioteca.
El juego ha evolucionado muy gratamente, con muchísimo contenido a todos los niveles, exploración, personalización historia...

Definitivamente un juego que merece la pena probar. Eso sí, llega un punto que puede que se haga un tanto repetitivo, pero habiendo tantas tareas y misiones que ir realizando, más explorar libremente... da para muchas horas de juego.
Además, se irán desbloqueando apartados nuevos (como los cargueros y asentamientos) a medida que vas avanzando en el juego y la historia.

A nivel de construcción: se pueden construir múltiples bases en cada planeta, montar sistemas de extracción de recursos, crear portales para viajar entre bases, puedes personalizar prácticamente cualquier cosa en ellas. También puedes construir bases submarinas, pero necesitarás el submarino primero.

A nivel de exploración: prácticamente infinito, te encontrarás multitud de planetas (algunos serán repetidos, pero cada uno tiene sus cosas para explorar), puedes usar los agujeros negros para avanzar más rápido a otras zonas...

A nivel de economía y recursos: se irán desbloqueando nuevos recursos conforme mejores los motores de la nave (para explorar cuerpos celestes de cierto tipo y encontrar otros recursos). La economía es bastante asequible, aunque también depende de la dificultad a la que juegues.

A nivel dificultad: completamente personalizable, puedes elegir entre modos o configurar cada apartado a tu gusto.

Puntuación actual: 8.5
Quizás le falte algo de variedad en los planetas y algo más de dificultad en el sistema de crafteo para hacerlo un poco más complejo.
Definitivamente, un juego a tener en la biblioteca si te gusta la exploración espacial.

185686005.review:
Despite the steep learning curve that I’ve had to partake in playing NMS as a newer/returning player. I decided to give the game another shot recently and to finish certain achievements/goals I had set out to complete in 2023. NMS has not disappointed in my return to the game in 2025 and it’s clear that the developers have listened to the community and remain passionate about the game with several gameplay improvements and new options for various gameplay styles.

While the multiplayer aspect can be slightly glitchy/buggy at times during combat (enemies glitching into floors/under terrain or not recognising a player) There is a distinctive improvement from first playing and I trust that the developers will continue to develop and improve on this in the future.  

The sheer visual transformation that No Man's Sky has also undertaken since playing for the first time has exceeded my expectations and made for a truly memorable and enjoyable gaming experience. Easily becoming a favourite game of mine, which I hope I will continue to enjoy for years to come. 

More gameplay and difficulty customisation also lures in newer or more casual players of the game who don’t want an intensive survival challenge. Perfect for cozy and relaxing gameplay or parallel play with a partner. So whether your jam is constructing elaborate bases, terraforming planets, teaming up with friends, joining in expeditions or just uncovering the secrets of a vast universe; there’s something for every player and I hope to see more people who initially wrote off the game, or haven’t tried it, a shot. 

PROS
- Stunning visuals and VR capability
- Engaging gameplay with a wide range of activities, even after achieving all achievements
- Robust Sandbox mode with endless creative possibilities
 - Frequently updated with new content and features
- Gameplay style/difficulty customisation 

CONS
- Some minor performance issues and glitches in multiplayer 
- Steep learning curve for new players

9.5/10

185662852.review:
Поиграв немного (31 час +-) могу сказать что No Man's Sky прекрасна!

------Графика-------
Мало что могу сказать по поводу графики в игре.
С одной стороны слишком некачественно как для игрока привыкшего играть на ультрах
С другой стороны как бы графика в игре не такой уж и важный аспект если в игре интересный геймплей и море контента.

------Геймплей-------
Игра захватывает очень на долго, и даже не конкретно одной какой то механикой а количеством контента
и тем, что ты можешь делать почти что угодно на просторах бесконечно не изученной вселены.
К примеру:
Ты можешь как и просто проходить квесты 
Так и Выживать,
Строить (Много строить),
Изучать вселенную,
Изучить комьюнити игры и их постройки,
Просто летать на космическом корабле попутно отстреливаясь от недоброжелателей,
Либо вообще забить на все и пойти проходить экспедицию...
Короче главный плюс игры в том что здесь редко когда может на скучать.

----Баги----
Их мало но они есть.
Самый бесячий это наверное что нажав F12 чтоб сделать скрин в Стиме игра тупо зависает
И тип скрины надо делать через саму игру.

----Сюжет----
Да он тут есть
Особо далеко не прошел но в принципе +- хороший

----Музыка и звуки----
Музыка довольно  атмосферно звучит (особенно в космосе)
А звуки в игре сделаны качественно 

---Атмосфера---
Если кратко то представьте что вы построили домик на майнкрафт сервере, 
но только вот ближайший какой либо игрок или его база находиться в миллионах км от вас, 
и вас окружает лишь бесконечный космос с изредка встречающимися системами планет. 

-----Комьюнити------
Игроки здесь довольно творческие если посмотреть на популярные постройки 
Строят как и подводные города так и небесные базы
Парой строят базы таких маштабов и красоты...

 ----Оптимизация----
Тут немного плохо становиться даже 4070ti на Ультра настройках поэтому играю на чуть выше средних
На других пк думаю запустит стабильно 120+ фпс на стандартных настройках



---Обожаю игры с бесконечной реиграбельностью 
Поэтому всем советую купить и поиграть в No Man's Sky
Возможно немного изменю отзыв когда наиграю 100-200 часов.---

185643711.review:
No Man's Sky is the ultimate redemption story in gaming. What started as a game full of unmet promises has evolved into one of the most expansive and immersive space exploration experiences out there. Hello Games has poured years of passion and dedication into turning this game into something truly special.

🔹 Pros:
[list]
[*][b]Endless Exploration:[/b] Billions of procedurally generated planets, each with unique ecosystems, landscapes, and lifeforms.
[*][b]Constant Updates:[/b] Free, massive updates that continually add new features, mechanics, and quality-of-life improvements.
[*][b]Base Building:[/b] Create anything from small outposts to massive colonies across multiple planets.
[*][b]Multiplayer:[/b] Seamless co-op exploration, base sharing, and missions with friends or strangers.
[*][b]Diverse Gameplay:[/b] Mining, crafting, trading, exploring, combat, and even farming—play how you want.
[*][b]VR Support:[/b] Fully playable in VR for an even more immersive experience.
[*][b]Space and Planetary Combat:[/b] Dogfights in space and ground-based combat add excitement to exploration.
[/list]
🔹 Cons:
[list]
[*][b]Repetitive at Times:[/b] Exploration can feel a bit grindy after a while.
[*][b]Learning Curve:[/b] The game doesn’t explain everything, and new players might feel lost early on.
[*][b]Occasional Bugs:[/b] While much improved, some bugs and performance issues can still pop up.
[/list]
No Man's Sky is a game about curiosity, discovery, and creativity. Whether you want to explore distant worlds, build a space empire, or just chill and watch alien sunsets, this game offers endless possibilities.

⭐ 9/10 – A universe worth getting lost in.

185614290.review:
《无人深空》是一款由Hello Games开发并发售的太空科幻冒险游戏，自发布之日到现在已经八年多的时间，游戏刚发布时我也简单游玩了一下，游戏内容空洞、优化差等原因也给游戏引来差评无数，八年后的今天，游戏经过大大小小数十次的更新之后，也算迎来了属于这款游戏的全新面貌，不管在游戏内容，游戏玩法以及游戏优化等方面都有着明显提升，慢慢也成为众多玩家理想中的太空冒险游戏。

宇宙探索一直是一个经久不衰的话题，人类对于太空的幻想也是由来已久，《无人深空》用自己独特的游戏表达方式为众多玩家营造了一个广袤无垠的太空世界，在这里你可以随意探索，通过你自己想要的方式去完成你的太空冒险，战士、商人抑或是探险家，只要你想，你都可以在这款游戏里实现你的传奇。

游戏在引导方面做到相当完善，进入游戏初始，你降落在一个不知名的星球上，失去了以往的记忆，为了可以离开这颗星球，游戏会不断引导你去完成修复飞船、完成资源鉴定等一系列功能，当受损飞船起飞，离开这颗星球进入广袤星空时，看着大大小小种类不一的各种星球时，让人不仅感叹，没错，这就是我想要的外星探索。

总体来说，无人深空在历经多年的免费更新后已经完成了历史性的蜕变，毕竟从当初的差评初潮到好评如潮也是众多玩家对制作组付出的肯定，如果对太空冒险游戏感兴趣的话，一定不可错过这一款集合了无数对冒险幻想的《无人深空》。

185609507.review:
Incredible game! 

It's a love-hate relationship with No Man's Sky, but it can win you over at the end of the day. When it's good and working, it's one of the best experiences gaming has to offer, but when it's bad, I'd rather play anything else. Optimization still seems to be lacking, but after everything the game has been through, I think it's safe to say that performance is in a contextually good state. Some elements of the game still tank FPS on standard settings, even with a PC that can run nearly every game maxed out on high settings, leading me to believe that some issues from launch are still present. That said, these occurrences are not very common, and performance overall is pretty good, though it can struggle at times.

There are some small annoyances: the grind for crafting feels excessive and tedious, the UI (mainly in menus) isn't great, and movement feels very janky. Changing directions doesn't feel responsive or smooth - you can really feel the momentum of the character, which leads to a sense of delay when changing directions. Sometimes this is intentional, especially with jetpacks, as different planets have varying levels of gravity. However, it takes some getting used to after playing games with more responsive movement.

No Man's Sky absolutely nails exploration and the thrill of discovering new and unique things as you journey through the universe. Almost every planet has something that makes you say, "Wow, that's really cool." Once you get through the initial grind and acquire some upgrades and wealth, the game truly opens up, going from somewhat enjoyable to borderline addictive. I saw No Man's Sky in my dreams.

The base-building elements were much better than expected and tied in phenomenally with resource collection. There were so many positive features in the game that I found myself wishing for a more narrative-driven experience and improved combat to create the ultimate game in every aspect.

I was already intrigued by Light No Fire, and after playing this, I'm excited to see more information about it. No Man's Sky has shown it has a strong foundation. If the current design and concept were polished further with a few additional tweaks, it could create an amazing experience in any setting. Not to mention the incredible progress made since the infamous launch. While the game’s current state isn't perfect, it’s more than good enough to prove that Hello Games knows what they’re doing when they take their time.

Get this game!

185572929.review:
I remember thinking how I will never get this game after finding out how disappointing it was post-launch. Glad I picked it up during a sale because this has turned out to be one of my favorite games. Technologically, this blows Starfield out of the water. Sure, Starfield technically has slightly better graphics, but No Man's Sky's art style makes up for it. You can't even compare anything else. 

You can take you ship anywhere you want to in a stellar system, actually pilot it and land it on any place on a planet without any stupid boundary boxes or loading screens, and build a great base to your liking. For example, I built my main base on top of and inside of a random floating mountain by digging out the terrain, and it looks great. The fact that you can do this without having Minecraft-level graphics should be a wake-up call for other game devs. In fact, the only loading screens come when you warp between different systems, but even those are more immersive that Starfield's. Even the procedural generation is way better because every planet actually feels different. Can't wait to try out an underwater base on a very Earth-like paradise planet I found and named.

At first I was worried there wouldn't be enough story-based missions to keep me entertained but that hasn't been the case at all so far. I have run into a lot of fun missions and encounters. Sure, the game is a bit grindy at times but things get a lot better once you set up some mining bases. In addition, you can play this with other people and even invite your friends. Respect to Sean Murray and the Hello Games team, they really put in the work over the years instead of running away with the money. Other studios should take notice.

Warning: This game is ridiculously addictive, so be careful.

185544109.review:
No Man’s Sky is, without a doubt, the best game I’ve ever played. Its sheer scope and the endless opportunities it offers make it an unforgettable experience. The vast, procedurally generated universe is a marvel, filled with countless planets to explore, each with its own unique ecosystem, flora, and fauna. This endless variety ensures that no two journeys feel the same.

The game thrives on the thrill of discovery, whether you're charting unknown star systems, mining rare resources, or encountering alien species. The sense of freedom is unparalleled, you can forge your own path, whether as an explorer, trader, or intergalactic fighter.

Beyond exploration, the amount of content is staggering. Building bases, upgrading ships and gear, diving into deep-sea environments, or even embarking on cooperative missions with friends—there’s always something new to do. The updates and expansions over time have only added to the game’s depth, making it feel like a living, evolving universe.

No Man’s Sky is not just a game; it’s an adventure that rewards curiosity and creativity. It’s a testament to how expansive and immersive gaming can be, offering endless possibilities and boundless exploration. For anyone with a love of discovery and adventure, this game is truly a masterpiece.

This is a tale as old as the game itself I expect. Like so many, I picked it up when it first came out and was disappointed with it. Over the intervening years I tried it another time or two and continued to have problems with it; and hadn't touched it now for about 2 years. I fired it up just before Christmas to give it another run since it was back in the news again and found it to finally be a delight, so much to do, so much to explore, and I've dropped about 60 hours into it.

Is it perfect? No, is there a lot to do in whatever schedule you've got to play games with? Absolutely. If you like any kind of survival/explore/build type title, give it a whirl.

No Man's Sky reminds me of why I fell in love with gaming in the first place; stepping into a world where I can truly get lost in the joy and exploration of the universe within.

Full respect and cheers to Sean and the entire development team for not just keeping their word at making this game  remarkable but wildly exceeding all of my expectations

185513129.review:
Excellent game about space exploration, crafting, farming and some fighting. 

Pros: 
- The price. It's ridiculously low compared to its durability
- It's only 20GB and very optimized, with all the modern options. 
- Because there are a lot of different things to do, you'll surely find something that you like in the game. 
- A true sense of exploration with an insane amount of planets, systems...and maybe galaxies ? 
- Deep crafting, machines, cooking, base building...

Cons: 
- Multiplayer activities are limited 
- The controls are pretty weird, some menus are clunky like construction. 
- Space combat controls is very hard if you don't use lock. 
- Controlling the spaceship takes a lot of adaptation. 
- Some annoying bugs (spaceships spawning in your base, trees growing in your base, the communication module that can't be removed by construction menu)

185466073.review:
This game is interesting. And it provides what many of us long wanted: The ability to travel through space and to procedurally generated planets.

You get a sense of loneliness as you play- since there are so few intelligent life forms, and those that you meet dont even speak english for the most part, so you have to learn their language.

The game features base building and mining aspects, and does fairly well in those areas. You can travel around, searching for specific resources and building a better, more opulent base.

You can also use vehicles, get a massive space freighter (capital ship), which you can use to transport all of your star fighters and other loot from place to place.

It is really something.

However, the universe feels a bit pointless. Theres not a big driver to do anything. The story is fairly light from what I'd seen of it back when I was playing, which was primarily a few years ago, so things could've changed.

When you die, you get super intelligent quotes such as: "I tell you, we are here on Earth to fart around, and don't let anybody tell you different."

Yes. That was a real quote that appeared on the screen when I died.

Another great one that can pop up when you die is: "I believe that life is a game, that life is a cruel joke."

But these gratuitous quotes, which sound like something written by a balding, 38-year-old man is his parents basement, trying to sound like a sophisticated adult, are not all the game struggles with narratively.

The game takes needless shots at religion throughout, and seems like it's written to try to make people have an existential crisis. Through the weak dialogue of the aliens you meet and the introspective thoughts of your character, you get a sense of: "Yeah, Life is meaningless and religious people are idiots. But hey! Who cares right? It doesnt matter anyway, right? And something really beautiful about that."

Do the dev's have a right to their opinions on all this stuff? Sure.

However, these feeble attempts at describing Existential Nihilism seem like a poor choice for narrative direction,

Especially considering how incredibly weak the would-be story elements and dialogue that I experienced was, at least back when I was playing.

All in all, the game itself is good-not perfect, but good. If they do a sequel, I'd recommend a better storyline, better interactions with NPCs and less of the preachy, life-is-meaningless shtick.

185457051.review:
72 hours in, I am on a maybe recommended level but that isn't an option so I go with 'ya whynot'. 
The game in essence feels like Mass Effect if it was written by the minecraft community. Minus the great characters (and running behind them if you know what i mean). 
It certainly has a charm which appeals to you or not, I enjoyed the experience so far. There are people here with 1000+ hours in it and I completely understand it, it feels like an escape from the real world problems it possible for a few hours.

+ If you like base building and mining raw material for countless hours then go for it, for me that went stale very quickly. The mechanics are quite nice, I enjoyed FO4 base building too so don't take me too seriously
+ You can update your ship, your tools, but there is no incentive really other than you feel good about it and you have storage and mine things quicker.
+ There are adventures you can go on with others
+ it is quite pretty

- The story is just lazy and you end up with more question marks in your mind after you finish the story lines. There are no conversations as such, just a few lines. I was actually thinking those interactions were generated but apparently no they were pre-written
- Mining mining mining, endless mining
- The worlds are generated for you and it really feels like it. I guess the biggest problem with that is the worlds feel random and just there for mining and getting to random buildings
- The explorable galaxy is WAAY too big for it's own good, nobody will ever see all the systems

185449043.review: Tedious, repetitive and overrated. The worst part is that there is no separation between the regular players and the "everything free" and "god mode enabled" players which just makes the whole thing feel utterly pointless. The game also suffers from extreme optimization issues, slow and laggy load screens and a general lack of refinement. No matter how much eye candy you throw at this thing the game just doesn't have enough core value to be worth while. Multiplayer is pretty terrible too, feels very disjointed and getting groups for anything is a painful experience. And finally, it's worth mentioning that this game is only masquerading as open space multiplayer game, everything is instanced to you alone unless you enter the main stations/hubs so it's in no way any open space/one universe type game. The graphics are not particularly pleasant either, every planet looks like a parrot threw up all over your screen.

185438876.review:
The journey this game has had since it's original release is impressive and inspiring. BUT, there's one thing that makes me not quite enjoy it to this day, and it's the ecology.
Simply put, the flora and fauna are to this day the most barebones and weakest aspect of the game. There's nothing interesting there, animals are just braindead props that walk around and plants are just props that do nothing.
Whenever I think of this game one of the first things that comes to mind is that clip in one of the original trailers, on a jungle planet with red vegetation and dinosaur like animals. You could see a herd of herbivores walking together and then some trees would collapse and a large predator would show up and chase the herd. 
That was the number 1 selling point for me. Landing on a planet and simply witnessing the procedurally generated life in it. Animals drinking water, hunting, eating, sleeping, etc. Plants that actually react to what happens around them and ideally even grow over time, and more.
Now, I know better than most just how hard it is to actually program those features into a game, let a lone get them to work procedurally. But the difficulty of the task is not really my concern. I was sold on that idea and it is still not present in the game in any way, thus I don't really enjoy it very much.

Bugs Bugs Bugs ah und Bugs!

Braucht Hello-Games nochmal 10 Jahre dafür das eine einfache Raffinerie in meinem Frachter funktioniert?
Habe die maximale anzahl in meinem Frachter und so richtig teure Mats drin... Ich freu mich wie'n keks... Alles gelöscht... SCHON WIEDER!

Mein Raumschiff meint beim Teleport immer wieder direkt vor der Tür oder IM HAUS zu Spawnen (manchmal fällt man dann richtig funny aus der Map).

Gefährliche Flora hat magischer weiße 100m range (was jetzt nich schlimm ist, aber ultra unatmosphärisch wenn man auf einmal dmg bekommt und schaut sich um und weiß "Ah die Venus Fliegenfalle 200m neben mir wars")

Ich könnt noch eine ganze weile so weitermachen... 
Ja ihr habt NUR 8 Jahre gebraucht bis ihr "größtenteils Positiv" bewertet wurdet. 
Das ihr das DERMAßEN gefeiert habt wundert mich JETZT nicht mehr, nachdem ich euer Spiel erlebt habe!
Würd mich auch freuen, wenn ich weiß wie viele Bugs ich ignoriere und diese Leute dennoch gut bewerten. 
Auf gut Deutsch, da scheißt einen Hello Games auf'n Tisch und meint es ist Pudding... und 80% der Leute freuen sich das er noch warm ist -.-

185405339.review: I played hundreds of hours on ps4 and am super excited to have the PC version now! I've been with NMS since day one and have seen firsthand the incredible transformation of this game. All DLC updates are free and you can tell there is huge love from the devs for the game and its community. The controls are overall much easier on mouse and keyboard, although i'm still getting used to flying the ship without a controller. If you like the idea of minecraft in space this game is definitely for you. the graphics are amazingly beautiful and the setting and tone are very peaceful and trippy. theres also no set game structure, there is a main objective like minecraft but overall you can just play and do whatever you want. my only wish / suggestion for this game is that they would add some satisfactory/ factorio type elements where you can automate the produciton of resources. Other than that this game is an 11/10 for me, it has a special place in my heart and i highly recommend it for people who like mining /crafting

Espero que sigan con este ritmo de actualizaciones y misiones, que dinamizan mas el juego.
Gracias a la gente de Hello Games por esta joya, que no fue el juego prometido cuando se lanzo, pero hace rato, que supero esa promesa con creces.

185377235.review: No Man's Sky has come a long way. I still remember waiting at GameStop for a PS4 copy at the midnight release, the excitement and the initial disappointment—three hours in, I was already playing something else. Hello Games missed the mark back then, but now? The game shines with stunning visuals, breathtaking planets, endless exploration, cool ships, base building, space battles, and even multiplayer—something originally promised but absent at launch. The team has worked hard, delivering massive updates and rebuilding trust. While it’s still light on story and goals, it’s perfect for peaceful exploration and creative building. It’s not the game we expected, but it’s absolutely worth a second chance. I recommend it just for that.

185377120.review:
The visuals are too cute for my taste, which is the main reason I stopped playing. However, I could tell this was a well-made game, and I think many people will enjoy it. I'm a fan of Star Citizen, which overlaps with this game in terms of concept, but I prefer its grittier style. The abundance of bright colors in this game can feel overwhelming to the eye. I understand the use of vibrant colors to create diverse combinations for the many worlds you'll visit, but it’s not for me.

One aspect I found impressive is how the game embeds the tutorial into the story campaign and integrates feature progression seamlessly. Building a starter base, constructing a ship, gathering resources to launch, and then visiting your first space station—all of this is done masterfully.

I also enjoyed the alien language learning system. Picking up words here and there and gradually understanding more of the aliens’ dialogue is a unique and engaging mechanic.

As a big fan of Valheim, I was particularly impressed by the terrain manipulation in No Man’s Sky. In Valheim, while you can manipulate the landscape with a pickaxe, you can’t carve tunnels with ceilings due to engine limitations. No Man’s Sky stands out because the terrain manipulation beam allows you to carve tunnels directly into the earth, which is both impressive and technically fascinating. I wonder how they achieved this.

Ultimately, I stopped playing because I started to feel that the planets would eventually stop feeling distinct from one another, apart from differences in atmospheres, flora, and fauna.

185348250.review:
В поисках идеальной игры про космос

В какой-то момент мне очень захотелось попробовать поиграть в космосим, и я начал рассматривать различные варианты. В итоге мой выбор пал на No Man's Sky. Мне приглянулись обширные возможности этой игры: хочешь — исследуй случайно сгенерированные планеты, строй на них базы, езди на вездеходах, хочешь — выполняй задания на космической станции, сотрудничай с пиратами или охоться на них. В общем, здесь есть масса активностей на любой вкус. И всё это с отличным саундтреком и приятной графикой.

Однако, при таком богатом контенте, некоторые механики игры,  к сожалению, страдают от недостаточной глубины. Например, вы не можете выйти в открытый космос из своего звездолёта, не можете построить базу на меторите. Кроме того, крупные корабли (фрегаты) передвигаются только при помощи телепортации из-за ограничений движка игры. 

В то же время, в другой игре про космос — Empyrion, есть возможность выходить из космолёта и строить базы на метеоритах. И даже очень большие корабли вполне могут плавно передвигаться в космическом пространстве. Отдельно стоит похвалить продвинутое конструирование звездолётов из мелких деталей. Но, несмотря на эти плюсы, в Empyrion не хватает разнообразия активностей, и достаточно быстро возникает ощущение того, что в игре просто нечего делать.

Я также рассматривал X4 Foundations. Это интересное сочетание стратегии и классического космосима, но, к сожалению, планеты в игре не реализованы, что для меня, как для любителя исследований, является серьёзным недостатком).

Отдельно хочу упомянуть сетевую составляющую No Man's Sky. По сути, NMS - это одиночная игра, но возможность играть с друзьями присутствует, однако реализация сетевых активностей иногда оставляет желать лучшего и может вызывать некоторые проблемы.

Несмотря на все перечисленные минусы, NMS остаётся великолепной игрой. Сейчас, спустя 150 часов игры, я чувствую, что она начинает немного наскучивать, но эти но эти 150 часов были просто космическими)

185291563.review:
I loved this game.  Endless exploration, strange creatures, a multitude of storylines and quests or assignments to do, base-building, creating your own ships... I mean seriously, one of the best games I've ever played.  Until I needed tech support.  Then it all came crashing down.  There is none.  I put 500+ hours in to this game, built some super-fun, awesome bases, had a plethora of really cool sentinel ships, a great pirate freighter; I was living my best (pixel) life.  Then my 500+ hour save somehow got corrupted; it would no longer load - throws an error - and I asked for help.  21 times, and 21 times I got an auto-reply with a list of standard "to-do's", which I had exhausted after the very first auto-reply.  I finally got fed up with the bot auto-replyer, and sent in report after report, thinking it MIGHT get someone's attention, and holy smokes, it did.  A live person finally replied, requesting my game files.  Overjoyed, after weeks of being ignored, I put them out on Google Drive... and never, ever heard back.  

Sure, I could start a new save; start grinding it all back, but if this is what I can expect if my new save craps out...  nah.  I'll go play something else.  Good luck all - but I would also make sure and save your game within Steam periodically, just in case.

185276034.review:
This game sucks.

I do like the transition between flying on world and going into space. There's a great feeling of distance and passing through the atmosphere. And that is literally the only thing about this game that is in any way enjoyable.

People act as if they fulfilled their promise on release because they added a basic base building and multiplayer function, so it's like a clone of Rust or something. But the actual gameplay is really nothing more than "need blue, shoot blue, craft blue thing. Need red, shoot red, craft red thing."

The promise they broke on release was that it had a spectacularly huge range of procedural content. But in practice, almost all of the variety consists of "this rock is a slightly different colour" or "that creature has slightly longer fingernails." But really there are only a dozen types of creatures. See that jumping mushroom? Expect to see it on every third planet.

Every planet consists of fields, sometimes trees, caves and tiny puddles. There are no continents, large bodies of water, mountains, or any kind of geography. Just kind of a flat expanse of the same thing over and over.

Space combat consists of "hold button to auto aim" and "shoot." On top of which, I remember seeing a space pirate fight and thinking "ooh, this could be fun." They start shooting at me, I shoot back and then get a message that they're the space cops and I pissed them off. There is no solution at this point. You cannot do anything. The space cops keep regenerating and chasing you and you just have to sit and wait for them to kill you.

I really, really, really tried to like this game. It's got elements I love. But the execution is a total failure in every single way. And they had the gall to charge me $60 for it.

It was trash on release, they made extremely superficial additions, and it's trash now.

185259341.review:
If you enjoy a Survival Base Builder this is the game for you! The crafting is next level and now with the crafting tree it is so much easier! Not to mention you can edit the difficulty settings to your liking so if you just wanna play in creative mode you can! No more tedious resource gathering! 

 My only gripe with this game is the multiplayer portion is still a bit glitchy. For example, if you try to warp with your group in your freighter it will cause their games to crash, also the fact we can't ride together in a star ship is strange, I feel like this should be a feature of the game by now. There are work arounds in place such as calling the anomaly and just warping to your friends' system. But the game feels more like a co-op experience rather than a true open world multi-player experience and it feels like a chore to play with your friends rather than a fun game. It takes a different level of dedication to the game to play with others. Which in my experience has turned off many of my friends to playing the game.

 But other than that this game is fantastic. I would still recommend it because there are no other games like it and I believe in Hello Games. They seem to listen to the fans and have made good on their promise of fixing the game. Many other Devs would've given up by now so I appriciate the love they put into the game.

185232358.review: 有一说一，游戏非常真实，符合对宇宙探索爱好者的需求，甚至在探索的画面表现力上超过了星空，但游戏性和新手引导可以说极其糟糕。以我所玩的仅仅十几小时来说，全程都是在找矿，找零件配方或购买零件配方，合成新物品，然后再找新矿，找新配方来解锁，合成新物品。可这有什么好玩的？合成列表繁杂且枯燥，背包容量又小，即使幸幸苦苦弄到了材料，也只是为了升级背包、武器、飞船而已。问题是你只能带一把武器在身上啊。这游戏我玩了十几小时，又没有boss级别生物，要枪真的只为了纯打小怪么？另外飞船虽然多种多样但购买的价格奇高无比，如果去修理别的星球上坠毁的飞船，需要的材料又无比繁多，而且大概率很多材料的配方还没有解锁，这游戏又不是以空战为卖点，就算我幸幸苦苦赚钱或是弄材料修理好了坠毁飞船，请问我要那么好的飞船和配件有什么用呢？飞的更远探索新星球找更高级的飞船残骸来修？最后升级背包也很蠢，为了有更多格子和功能，我需要更多原料和零件或者钱，而为了能装更多的原料和零件升级格子或卖钱，所以我需要更多的格子？

185231167.review:
Bought it a long time ago (when it was a disaster) and refunded it.  Tried it again, (on special) after many years and renewed positive reviews.  All I can say is people must be easily pleased.  After just 100+ hours in the game, it is just a long, boring, confusing and repetitive grind with little reward.  Missions are bland, boring quests.....fly here - there, meet aliens you'll never understand, fly back and get rewarded with a few parts, or a small payment pretty much useless for anything.  Rinse and repeat hundreds of times.  Main and side missions stack up one after another but never get finished. They just seem to endlessly drag on.  There's not one, but 3 currency types in the game, and the one you need the most is the hardest to get.  Even to research the most basic base materials, you need hours and hours of flying, walking and searching for spare change and scrap parts to exchange.  It's way over complicated than it ever needs to be.
Some games I can enjoy starting over time and time again, spending thousands of hours in total.  This one has little to offer past 100 hours than just more pretty graphics.  I'm pretty much done and dusted if I'm not going to feel progress.

185183629.review:
Ah, the joys of modern gaming! I already own No Man's Sky on PS5 and love playing it there. The only reason I decided to buy the PC version was for the advertised Cross-Save feature. Seamless saves across platforms? That sounded perfect.

But here is the problem. Cross-Save is not exactly Cross-Save. It is more like Cross-Your-Fingers-And-Hope-There-Is-Space-On-Their-Cloud. Spoiler alert: there probably is not. And how do you find this out? Not through clear messaging before purchase. That would be too straightforward. Instead, you only discover the truth after you have paid for the game, downloaded it, and tried to use the feature. Surprise, it does not work.

Who thought this was a good idea? "Let us advertise a key feature but hide its limitations in the FAQ." Players love spending money only to find out the main reason they bought the game does not actually work.

So here I am, staring at a game that promised seamless saves across platforms but instead delivered a pile of disappointment. Maybe they should rename it No Save’s Sky. At least that would be honest.

Thanks, Hello Games, for reminding me that in the vast universe of promises, some features are just black holes.

185161904.review:
Luego de 60 horas jugadas no voy a negar que este juego en un comienzo me atrapo,visualmente No Man's sky es muy bonito y los planetas hay muchos que son muy asombrosos de ver, pero aparte de eso siento que es un juego que intenta hacer muchas cosas pero todas las hace meh..

La exploración en un comienzo es muy divertida pero luego de 10 horas se  se vuelve bastante repetitiva y aburrida, todos los edificios que puedes explorar son exactamente iguales en todos los planetas, esto sin excepción, si ya viste los de un planeta, ya viste los de todos los planetas. 

lo que es el sistema de construcción de bases es igual, hay variedad en cuanto a piezas se refiere pero igualmente se siente bastante mediocre a comparación de otros juegos, se siente que la añadieron solo para darle más variedad al gameplay.

El manejo de la nave pues no esta del todo mal pero tiene unas físicas de vuelo un tanto toscas y muy árcade para mi gusto,pero luego de un rato te acostumbras y pues no esta tan mal, hablando de eso, las exonaves se manejan horrible, (a excepción del traje Mecha) todas tienen unos controles todos toscos y se manejan con el ratón de la pc de una forma super rara,pero igualmente te terminas acostumbrando, pero siendo sincero casi todos los vehiculos se siente de esa forma, bien ok .

El combate tambien se podria decir que esta ahi, pero igualmente se siente super monotono y aburrido, no hay mucha variedad de enemigos y pues de los pocos que hay son más que todo oleadas de sentinelas que en algunos planetas te atacan por que si, (en otros planetas son calmados y no atacan a menos que mines recursos frente a ellos), todo depende del nivel de peligrosidad del planeta, pero estos enemigos más que un reto solo son una molestia, no son dificiles de matar pero tampoco te dejaran en paz hasta que te alejes de ellos,y aún con los percs de invisibilidad te siguen todo el camino hasta la zona donde estes, por lo que no te dejaran explorar en paz y te estaran spawneando asi por que si a cada rato(esto solo es en planetas de alto peligro).
Esto mismo aplica a las peleas en el espacio que son igual de aburridas, puedes quedarte quieto mientras te atacan naves piratas y facilmente las puedes derrotar sin mucho esfuerzo.

Hay más cosas que me gustaria agregar pero mucho texto,en conclusión, el juego al comienzo es interesante y bastante entretenido, pero rapidamente toda esa cobertura de maquillaje se va desvaneciendo con el paso de las horas.No me arrepiento del todo de haberlo comprado pero tampoco considero que sea un juego "pulido" como muchos aseguran en videos de Youtube. "No Man's sky es bueno ahora", osea si, pero siguen habiendo juegos mucho mejores y más baratos que este que dan más valor por tu dinero, aunque no voy a negar que es asombroso que existe un juego con una galaxia casi infinita.

185150519.review:
I understand me posting this with the amount of hours I have may make it seem like I just touched it then just said "Nah I dont wanna play noh moh". I have played on a separate platform for many hours and built large bases and collected a lot of ships and gear. 

OK, I will recommend this game for a number of reason but before I even get started on the positive, let me just mention some of the down sides, because yes sure you can read a lot of positives before the bad or just have a bad review in general, but lets switch it up a little. 


The bad:
- The main problem I have here is that some items that you could unlock for like events just stay locked in your Customization menu forever, like I understand you do not want the troubles of having to hide it for every player, but it makes the experience for new players kinda bad. It also drives them away because now they can never unlock them unless in some way down the road, they decide to bring back the event. 

- Secondly, the new platform cloud save feature, look I get that you are working on trying to get the platform cross saves to work and have it in testing, but when it is limited to a few players when there are many many players wanting to play on old saves on different platforms, and it makes old saves (Such as one of my oldest saves with some old builds and gear) a few steps away but its like a teaser more than a feature. Very frustrating when you just wanna visit an old save and just pick up where you left off. 

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Great now that we have the two main issues I have with the game and think they should pay more attention to, lets move onto the positives!

- Sure the game can be repeating but the amount of visuals, different creatures and biomes, ships and creations by other players, and the best thing is that no matter how much you explore, you will always have more and more. 

- The Factions always have missions for you and you can always improve or harm relations with them, its like a RPG and a Exploration game mixed together. 

- You can build bases and share them to the community for them to visit and explore if they wish to, allowing more diversity and allowing people to share their creative talents. 

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

There that is my Recommendation, but the most frustrating thing is that cross platform cloud save feature, it has been there for a while to my knowledge and no slots have opened for people in Months.

185139550.review:
Juro que me esforcei para tentar gostar do jogo, mas...

É MUITO REPETITIVO!

Os planetas, plantas e animais claramente são um baita de um `sort()` entre eles. É perceptível que a aleatoriedade do mundo é grotesca. Um animal tem uma cabeça pequeninha em um corpo de um ogro de 20 metros e não sei como conseguem achar isso incrível. O mapeamento dos planetas se parar para olhar com mais detalhes, dá para ver que são sempre os mesmos e com apenas algumas variações. Chegando em um planeta você vai ter algumas coisas pra fazer que é:

1. Abrir o teu scanner e olhar o que tem no planeta
2. Escanear plantas, animais e minérios
3. Procurar construções que são elas: Ruínas, pedaços de coisas aleatórias pra farmar, minérios e construções que vão ser sempre as mesmas nos 3000 planetas que você vai encontrar pelo caminho.
4. Farmar

As missões secundárias são genéricas e não possuem história nenhuma. Faça isso, busque aquilo, mate aquilo e por ai vai. E geralmente suas recompensas são Nanites ou alguma moeda específica do jogo que é usada para comprar algum cosmético. 

Beleza, farma pra caramba, fica cheio de Nanites e agora finalmente pode ter um jetpack classe S plus +, uma nave com a pintura do whatsapp e uma roupinha bacana. Após comprar o upgrade pra você equipá-lo, advinha o que tem que fazer? Farmar mais. Vá em um planeta e repita aqueles 3 pontos que citei acima e finalmente vc pode equipar teu jetpack atualizado. Quer um carro? Farma NANITES, compra o upgrade e faça aquele loop tudo de novo. 

Quer construir tua base? Loop. 
Achou um vilarejo que vc tem que tomar conta? Loop. 
Tá fazendo a missão principal? Loop.
Quer uma nave nova? Loop.
Expedição? Loop do loop.

Enfim, o jogo é muito nichado e não é pra todo mundo. É só pra quem gosta mesmo de uma exploração com N variações. Essas variações não me encantaram e nem fizeram com que o jogo ficasse mais bonito. É algo X com atributos Y Z que sempre é encontrado com variações Y+1 e Z+1. 

Chato pra caramba.

They NEED to rethink transferring equipment between primary saves and expeditions.
As a new player i started off on a normal playthrough but about an hour or two later i started an expedition from my primary save. From there i continued to on the expedition for the majority of my playtime, having attained a great freighter as well as several A class ships i was quite happy with. Now, nowhere was a new player are you warned that these are effectively temporary, save for the ability to clone your multi tool and primary starship. as i later found out that the expedition instance simply ceases to exist along with any and all progress associated. sure i get nanites and units at the end but what i find ridiculous is that expedition instance had far more in terms of currency than what i was awarded. 

It seems so clear that the easy solution to this would be to make this a separate save as it would be had you started it as an expedition from the main menu. I suppose my main issue is just the lack of red tape and warnings, especially as a new player starting an expedition from my primary save.

185115438.review:
Disappointingly Underwhelming!!

I had high hopes for No Man’s Sky, but unfortunately, it turned out to be one of the most boring gaming experiences I’ve ever had. The promise of endless exploration quickly fades when you realize there’s very little to do that feels meaningful or engaging.

The controls are unintuitive and frustrating, making it hard to immerse yourself in the game. On top of that, the player’s perspective takes up an annoyingly large portion of the screen, which further detracts from the already lackluster visuals.

While the idea of exploring a vast universe sounds great in theory, the execution is painfully repetitive. Every planet feels the same after a while, with little to no variation or incentive to keep going. The gameplay lacks depth, and it’s hard to shake the feeling that you’re just wasting your time.

Overall, No Man’s Sky is a disappointment. It’s not worth the time or money unless you enjoy endless monotony and clunky controls.

I just want to start of addressing some of the negative reviews that I see on steam. Many of them have played the game for 10-40h.

This isn't a game you can review to the fullest after "only" 40h of game time. It take ... a lot ... to really get into it and I'm not saying it's easy. I gave up twice back in the day because I didn't see the point, but I was drawn back in and this is why ...

Saying "best comeback in gaming history" has become worn out when it comes to NMS. Doesn't make it untrue though. You can spend hours on end doing stuff completely irrelevant to the story. Searching for that right planet that meets your criteria for a base. Finding that S-class dreadnaught, Building the ship just the way you want it to look. It just keeps going ... Hello Games has set the mark what a survival/sandbox space game is supposed to look like.  And I'm dreading ... DREADING ... what Light no Fire might bring because it may cost me my marriage X-)

If anything negative to say it would be that you eventually hit a limit where you are S-Class across the board, everything is maxed out. But thank god (or HG) they are still dropping updates, new content, expeditions etc that keeps the game alive.

I feel bad though for new players that are missing years and years of content. I personally think it would be great if HG implemented, let's call it a expedition-tree. Starting from the first expedition to the last where you need to complete one to unlock others. Connecting them with a storyline. In that way - everyone would have the same experience as us old-timers (even though we've waited a long time for each expedition).

And I'm hoping SO MUCH that the rumours of a NMS version for the Nintendo Switch 2 is true. If the Expedition-Tree would come to a reality I would do the entire f-ing thing again from scratch on the Switch 2.

Thanks you HG

185057520.review:
I already spent 60h in this game that I don't regret, but I won't go further and I don't recommend it.

It *is* beautiful and unique. Just the possibility to land anywhere on a planet, explore, then take off to another planet or another system is fantastic. They all look strange, switching between funny wonderlands and hostile Dune-like deserts. The world is simple huge: you can get on planets that no player has visited before.

The obvious and expected drawback of this vastness is the emptiness of the game. There are resources, bases, enemies, wrecks everywhere but they all feel the same. You can land anywhere on a given planet, but it will be the same everywhere: the biome will be identical between poles and equator. Same for the day/night cycles that won't change. Exploring a planet is then without interest past the few kilometers around your landpoint.

Crafting: you collect all the time the same resources again and again (and it takes quite some time) to recharge your tools, and craft different object (tool upgrades, ship upgrades etc). But you also collect tons of items here and there. After 60h I have dozens and dozens of items that I don't even know whether they are useful. My inventory can't stop getting full of I-don't-know-what, which is very frustrating. And I can't sell it because it will be useful and hard to get in the future...

You can have an admiral ship and send hired bots to different missions. It consists in: choosing the mission, choosing the team, ensuring they have sufficient skill and fuel, and wait. When they get back you earn money, items, and you have to hop on the ships to repair them by yourself. It is not very rewarding or entertaining.

There are automatically generated missions that all look the same since there are automatically generated. The main mission itself feels like a seconday mission. I don't know where the story leads me and I'm not even curious at this point. None of the characters are interesting, none of the worlds you have to visit in the storyline are particularly interesting either (not anymore than any in the game). Sometimes you get to choose a line during a dialogue and I never felt it had a consequence.

It is marvelous in some way, but I feel like I tried to explore emptiness during 60h. It also feels like I still have 60h of procedural content to explore, and I just don't want it.
