Puoi passare ore divertendoti anche su un solo pianeta, esplorando fauna, piante, minerali, oppure continuando a visitare sistemi e pianeti diversi che rivelano paesaggi mozzafiato. Ha, però, le sue pecche. Nonostante il multiplayer esista e sia molto divertente, l'esperienza di gioco non è immersiva come dovrebbe. Dagli eventi climatici che non si sovrappongono, ai vari bug legati al multiplayer, che seppure non siano così "gravi" rendono tutto più "macchinoso". Male anche la mancanza di un editori delle astronavi. Creare la tua astronave risulta molto macchinoso ed è poco personalizzabile. In generale un 9- (voto eccellente, considerati i difetti). Il gioco viene aggiornato spesso, ma già così può divertirvi per mesi.

183528765.review:
TLDR: I enjoyed it however I have to critique the whole. Between the initial purchase on Xbox 1 and now, I have more time than is shown on my steam account. The game offers a large universe with shallow survival mechanics, base building, and customization, while its space combat, mission system, and economy fail to provide depth or challenge, making it feel repetitive despite updates and expansions

Now for the bullet points


Procedural Generated Universe: overall the universe will eventually stagnate on a longer play through.
Survival Elements. In my experience the systems were in place but I found them rather shallow. They were more of an afterthought rather than a game changing feature, mid to end game you can withstand the majority of the hazards pretty regularly
Base Building: overall the base building features were on par with the average survival style game but were made irrelevant functionally by the features of the freighter
Trading and Economy:I never really found this feature to be game changing. I suppose if you were doing an RP play through of the game it could be utilized as a narrative item. But overall you can make a substantial amount of money through other activities. 
Upgrades and Customization: overall the customization was shallow. I am a stickler for in depth crafting and customization options, especially in the genre of game. The majority of the “upgrades” you get have a minimal effect on game play. I never really encountered a situation where I thought to myself “man, I really should have optimized better for the XYZ situation”. The ship customization was a joke. I do not want to spend millions of dollars on a bunch of components to get my “dream ship” and even then the single class system kinda ruined me making my combat hauler hybrid.
Space Combat: space combat was serviceable as a feature, but I never felt like it was a challenge. The variety was minimal, I think there are very few events you can drop into in the open world. The pirate hunts were pretty consistent as far as the encounter, usually  3 waves of 3  ships   or something similar
Mission System: the mission system became fragmented as updates rolled out. The main story, the base building missions, the atlas missions and everything in between just left me feeling very unenthused. 
Freighter and Fleet Management: The freighter was rather game breaking. Once you had a freighter it became a mobile base. The mission system within the freighter basically paid for your entire run once you got it up and running. I know I have worn out the term “Shallow” in this review but it is strongly applicable.
Expansions and Updates: I commend Hello games on sticking with this title from its rocky launch to the state it is in now. If they condensed everything they have implemented into the game into a smaller package, I think it would be a high quality title. The size and low depth of the game is where I found fault with it. You cannot have scale without sacrifice.
Rich Lore and Storytelling. To save you time, it's really shallow and I cannot think of a single lore point that stuck in my brain as interesting. Adding in a quest line that explored each faction in depth would have probably been the route to take. Having a fixed home world as part of the universe, race specific unlocks, race specific quest lines, perhaps some manner of reputation system, maybe diplomacy missions as part of an alternate ending. Just something to spice up the sum of the whole
